comments.text:
(Surfacing a bit of important context from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1604844#c23 to the top level here, for clarity)

The `deletion-request` ping contains a `sync_device_id` field, which corresponds to the `deviceID` field of the [sync ping](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/toolkit/components/telemetry/data/sync-ping.html). For reasons, the `deviceID` field of the sync ping is 64 characters long but the `sync_device_id` in the deletion request is only the first 32 characters. So we need to delete sync pings where the first 32 bytes of the `deviceID` matches the `sync_device_id` from the deletion request.
comments.creator: ryan@rfk.id.au
comments.author: ryan@rfk.id.au
comments.raw_text:
(Surfacing a bit of important context from https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1604844#c23 to the top level here, for clarity)

The `deletion-request` ping contains a `sync_device_id` field, which corresponds to the `deviceID` field of the [sync ping](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/toolkit/components/telemetry/data/sync-ping.html). For reasons, the `deviceID` field of the sync ping is 64 characters long but the `sync_device_id` in the deletion request is only the first 32 characters. So we need to delete sync pings where the first 32 bytes of the `deviceID` matches the `sync_device_id` from the deletion request.
